title: 404 when loading inline app with hash in URL (Safari only)
body:
### Describe the bug

When building with `output.bundleStrategy === 'inline'`, using a hash-based router is essentially required. With that set-up, the following is true:

- Entering the location of the `index.html` file into a browser's URL bar loads the app
- Entering the location of `index.html` plus `#/path/to/page` loads the correct page within the app
- Entering the above plus a "real" hash -- something like `file:///path/to/index.html#/page#id-on-page` -- breaks, but only in Safari, as the second "#" gets encoded to `%23` and the URL becomes `file:///path/to/index.html#/page%23id-on-page`.

Neither Chrome nor Edge have this issue. Internal links with `href="#/page#id-on-page"` still work correctly on all browsers.

### Reproduction

Download Rich's [snek](https://svelte-snek.vercel.app) demo. In Safari, attempt to open `file:///<path>/snek.html#/about#test`. This will 404 as `file:///<path>/snek.html#/about%23test`. In Chrome and Edge, this correctly just ignores the spurious hash (and would correctly jump to the element, if it existed).
